gpt4o_mi: Rothaig na Túatha Dé Danann tríd tíortha i bhfad i gcéin agus fairsing, ag tumadh iad féin i gceol, i rince, agus i gceoltra nuair a bhí siad ag glacadh leis na cultúir agus traidisiúin éagsúil a bhuail siad leo.
English_sentence: The Túatha Dé Danann journeyed through lands far and wide, immersing themselves in music, dance, and song while embracing the diverse cultures and traditions they encountered.

gpt4o_mi: I catuiriuc re-mthaith uo gniomrachtaib fioshthudá ro chellad urt a heachtranna isha bflatine tosaighi, is Murias is Findias.
English_sentence: In cities such as Falias, Gorias, Murias, and Findias, they practiced music and dancing.

gpt4o_mi: Do Fhálias do aireadh claidheamh Núadu. Ní thoccoighead duine ar bith an claidheamh acht rí Éireann.
English_sentence: From falias was brought the sword of Núadu. No one could ever touch the sword except the king of Ireland.

gpt4o_mi: Rugadh cauldron an Dagda ón nGorias. Bhraith cuid acu gur thug sé dóibh an méid a bhí uathu, cé nach raibh a leithéid ag daoine eile.
English_sentence: From Gorias was brought the Dagda's cauldron. Some people felt it gave them what they needed, while others didn’t.

gpt4o_mi: In cloch Fáil, atá i dTeamhair, tugadh í ag Findias agus iompraíodh gach rí Éireann í óir ba mhór an meas ar an gcloch agus ba éigean dóibh í a iompar.
English_sentence: The Stone of Fál, which was located in Tara, was brought by Findias and carried by every king of Ireland since it was so respected and they had to carry it.

gpt4o_mi: Tucad claideb Núadu a Murias, agus is creidter é bheith ro-chumachtach 7 ábalta duine ar bith do marbad.
English_sentence: From Murias was brought the sword of Núadu which is believed to be extremely powerful and capable of killing anyone.

gpt4o_mi: Do bhí ceathrair ealadhan maith agsuin ndá ceithri cathair sin. Ba i bhFalias a bhí Morfesa; Ba i nGorias a bhí Esras; Ba i bhFindias a bhí Uiscias; Ba i Murias a bhí Semias. Is iad sin an céathrar ó na Túatha Dé a d’fhoghlaim ceol agus damhsa.
English_sentence: There were four great artists in those four cities. Morfesa was in Falias; Esras was in Gorias; Uiscias was in Findias; Semias was in Murias. Those are the four people from whom the Túatha Dé learned music and dance.

gpt4o_mi: Is naimhde do réir a chéile iad na Túatha Dé agus na Fomoire, agus níor mhian le Balor, garmhac Néit, go bpósfadh a iníon Ethne Cían, mac Dhían Cécht. Ach bhuail Ethne agus Cían dá chéile go rún, agus rug sí Lug níos déanaí.
English_sentence: The Túatha Dé and the Fomoire were enemies, and Balor, the grandson of Nét, did not want his daughter Ethne to marry Cían, the son of Dían Cécht. But Ethne and Cían met in secret, and she later gave birth to Lug.

gpt4o_mi: Do rinneadh cath Maige Tuired idir iad agus na Fir Bholg. Bhuaigh na Fir Bholg, agus tháinig 100,000 díbh slán maraon leis an rí, Eochaid mac Eirc.
English_sentence: The battle of Mag Tuired was fought between them and the Fir Bolg. The Fir Bolg won, and 100,000 of them survived including the king, Eochaid mac Eirc.

gpt4o_mi: Do écc Edleo mac Allai, Ernmas, Fíacha, ocus Tuirill Bicreo i cath, co ro chertslúag fir Túatha Dé Danann.
English_sentence: Edleo mac Allai, Ernmas, Fíacha, and Tuirill Bicreo died in the battle, reducing the Túatha Dé Danann’s strength.

gpt4o_mi: An Fir Bholg a d'éalaigh, rith siad go dtí na Fomoire. Rinne siad tithe nua ar na hoileáin Árainn, Íle, Manainn, agus Reachlainn.
English_sentence: The Fir Bolg who got away ran to the Fomoire. They made new homes on the islands of Arran, Islay, Man, and Rathlin.

gpt4o_mi: Tánic coimlán for céin bá cóir rigi for muintir nÉrenn. Ámh, bítis Túatha Dé ocus a mnáthar for Núadu a epsu a lám do bered a flaith.
English_sentence: A dispute arose over who should rule Ireland's people. However, Túatha Dé and their wives still supported  Núadu to be the king even after losing his hand.

gpt4o_mi: Rop éigse teachtai inni ar in modh fuaradar Brese, 7 ní ruc éenchoisc doridisi ar in fhírinne sin.

gpt4o_mi: Ba and Ériu, ingen Delbáeth, oc amharc ó thaigh Máetha Sénín lá, is é a bhí roimpi fairsinge mara dochumach.

gpt4o_mi: Síleadh leo nárbh fhiú Bres mac Elatha a dhéanamh ina rí. Cé gur thóg siad mar a gcuid féin é, bhí imní orthu go dtabharfadh sé iomarca smachta do na Fomóraigh, ós is iad a bhí i gceannas ar Elatha a athair cheana féin.
English_sentence: They thought it wouldn’t be right to make Bres the son of Elatha king. Even though they had raised him as their own, they worried it would give the Fomorians too much control, since his father Elatha was already their king.

gpt4o_mi: Do chonnairc sí an ní aisteach éigin agus í ag fanacht ann: long mhór airgid ag teacht i radharc ar an muir. Ba é dalladh mór é, ach ní raibh sí in ann a chruth a fheiceáil go soiléir. Brúigh an t-uisce go mall é i dtreo na talún.
English_sentence: As she stayed there, she saw something strange: a big silver boat came into view on the sea. It looked very large, but she couldn’t see its shape clearly. The water slowly pushed it toward the land.
